rem:c_requirementsSpecification.rem:name: Specifications of the Requirement System [Tabernas Sevilla MadejaIR]

rem:paragraph.rem:name: Introduction
rem:paragraph.rem:text:
Tabernas Sevilla is a well-known chain of restaurants in Seville that has been around since 2001. There are four establishments across the capital, which are usually visited by young adults and families. Its specialty are sevillian tapas and dishes. They also have a very large wine menu

Our system fulfils three fundamental functions for Tabernas Sevilla's business model. It is based on a web page that allows the ordering of commands on-line. Using a computerized web menu, users can select which dishes from Tabernas Sevilla's extensive menu they wish to order and which of the 4 restaurants available throughout Seville to collect them from, giving them an estimated time to collect the order on site or selecting delivery to the previously specified address.

In addition, it has the functionality implemented to manage the capacity of the bar's customers, being able to make table reservations in advance by agreeing on a time, and if desired, also agreeing on the dishes to be consumed. In this way, the client does not have to wait for his dishes when he arrives at the bar but can enjoy them in the best possible way. This helps to solve one of the basic problems of the business, the management of the waiting list, which is currently done by hand by the waiters.

rem:graphicFile.rem:name: Location of the restaurants

rem:paragraph.rem:text: The project is directed to the Owner of "Tabernas Sevilla", Pablo Arenas, with whom we contacted thanks to one of the members of our project. In his organization, we can find different positions and users of the system to be developed.

rem:graphicFile.rem:name: Office of the owner

rem:paragraph.rem:text: The following describes the people involved in the development of the software project and the roles they play:

rem:organization.rem:name: Tabernas Sevilla
rem:organization.rem:address:
Avenida de HYTASA nª12 Planta 3
Puerta 19 41005 Sevilla - España

rem:paragraph.rem:text:
The following describes the main objectives that are expected to be achieved when the system to be developed is in production:
- Automate operational processes: In this way we can optimize the company's resources and achieve a more efficient management.
- Provide the information that supports the decision making process: the system will provide the organization with various relevant information about the business that can be used to make decisions that directly affect the organization.
- Achieve competitive advantages: optimizing resources, making processes automatically and obtaining information relevant to the business model will provide the company with strategic supremacy over the competition.

rem:section.rem:name: Information about the domain of the problem

rem:paragraph.rem:text:
The company for which the creation of our system is intended is called Tabernas Sevilla. This chain of restaurants with 4 establishments in Seville has been serving tapas and wine since 2001.
These restaurants work very well both for regular customers and for passers-by, so we decided to provide new distribution methods and make the existing ones more efficient in order to allow this company to sell more products.
Tabernas Sevilla already has a website that allows the reservation of tables with or without a menu selection beforehand. We intend to add to the website the possibility for customers to have their meals delivered wherever they want around the restaurants. We also plan to add a take away system to avoid waiting for customers. These two systems will make it possible to sell products without being limited by the capacity of the different restaurants of Tabernas Sevilla.
In addition to these new sales methods, we are going to implement a social media involvement system consisting of a review system and others in order to inform the customer and, as its name suggests, involve him in the life of Tabernas Sevilla.
Finally, we have decided to improve the management of the waiting list by allowing us to inform the customer of how much time he or she has left before being able to settle in the restaurant.
All these actions can be carried out via the website once the customer has registered and logged in to their profile.

rem:section.rem:name: Glossary of terms of the problem domain

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: Bookings
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
Bookings at Tabernas Sevilla can be made either by phone or directly through their website. These are only available for groups of 6 to 20 people and are available until 2:30 pm for lunch and 9:30 pm for dinner. Reservations are not made on the terrace so that there is always room for passers-by.
Once the reservation is made, an email will be sent to the customer to pay 25% of the price if he chose his menu during the reservation or 3 euros if he will order on the spot to validate the reservation. If the customer has not chosen a menu during the reservation, then he will not be able to order tapa unless it is the only format of the desired dish.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: Customers, Diner
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text: Customers of Tabernas Sevilla are mostly families and young adults. We noticed that there were very few children when we went there.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: Delivery
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
Our site will offer an online ordering system that can then be either delivered or picked up directly at the desired restaurant. In addition, the details of the order will be available as well as the invoice.
The delivery system will display in real time the status of the order with an estimated time of arrival.
An estimated time for order pickup will also be provided.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: Establishments, Taverns
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
Tabernas Sevilla has four restaurants in different areas of the city of Seville, which in order of their opening are in Porvenir, Torneo, Nervión and Arenal.
These establishments all operate independently, however, they all offer the same menu, allowing customers to enjoy the same products regardless of the restaurant of this brand. In addition, all its establishments have a bar and a room, only the layout of these two elements and their location in the city change.

rem:graphicFile.rem:name: Taberna Arenal

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: Owner
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text: Tabernas Sevilla's manager is named Pablo Arenas. He is half owner of this business.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: Review
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
Our site will be equipped with a rating system that will allow you to rate and leave comments on the different dishes offered by this restaurant. Indeed, logged users will be able to give a rating from 0 to 5 stars and write a comment to support their rating.
Thus, customers and restaurant staff will have the opportunity to be informed of the success of a dish and have more details than a rating thanks to the comments.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: Tapas
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
Tapas are small salty Spanish dishes, usually served with drinks in a bar.Tabernas Sevilla sells 60 different tapas classified in 8 categories which are dessert, meat, own kitchen, salad, omelettes, bar, boards, cheese and cold meats which prices vary between 2 and 18 euros depending on the desired dish and its quantity.
These dishes are offered in 3 different quantities, in tapa, half ration and full ration, however, the tapas portions are only available by reservation if the customer indicates these dishes, otherwise, only the dishes only offered in tapas will be available once on site.
They are all available at this address: https://www.arengalia.es/carta-de-tapas

rem:graphicFile.rem:name: A picture of a dish

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: User profile
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
The client will be able to connect to the Tabernas Sevilla website in order to access different functionalities such as delivery or take away of meals.
In addition, they will be able to give their opinion on the different dishes ordered through their profile and will be able to access the history of their orders in order to find a particular dish.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: Waiting list
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
The waiting list is independent at each Tabernas Sevilla restaurant. It is managed directly by the waiters and the restaurant manager.
It is for the moment very rudimentary but is intended to be computerized in order to allow a less long waiting time for customers and a better management for the staff.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: Website
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
The client will be able to connect to the Tabernas Sevilla website in order to access different functionalities such as delivery or take away of meals.
In addition, they will be able to give their opinion on the different dishes ordered through their profile and will be able to access the history of their orders in order to find a particular dish.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: Wines
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
Tabernas Sevilla offers 5 types of wines which are the generous, cellar, rosé, white and red for a total of 41 different wines to date.
These wines are offered in bottles whose price starts at 10 euros and can go up to 35 euros but some of them are also available in glass from 1.8 euros to 2.6 euros.
Finally, the customer can ask the waiter and access the history of the wines of the week of this brand, knowing that Tabernas Sevilla offering its wines of the week can be unique to one of the 4 restaurants or common to all.
All of them can be find at this adress : https://www.arengalia.es/carta-de-vinos

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: Working stations
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
A piece of hardware that allows the waiter to assign the orders to a virtual table, and when the customer asks for the bill, the program will generate a bill according to the assigned food.
Working stations can be found in any of the establihsments, for each of them there is one static monitor for the bar, and a portable PDA for every waiter. Working stations use an application called BDP-NET software (see figures 8 and 9).

rem:paragraph.rem:text: Currently, the business is going through challenging times. The pandemic that we live in makes it hard for the hostelry sector to succeed and reach their business goals. However, Tabernas Sevilla is financially stable and mature enough to resist these challenges.

rem:section.rem:name: Pros and cons of the current situation

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: 01 - Maturity
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text: The main advantage of Tabernas Sevilla is the age of the business. Since they started in 2001, they have had enough time to fix all the problems that have appeared during the business lifetime and to gain a good reputation in Seville.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: 02 - No issues
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text: There are no significant issues to solve now, and that makes us able to make new improvements.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: 01 - Covid19
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text: The ongoing pandemic makes it difficult to invest in new features and techniques.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: 02 - Complex booking
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text: The current process to book a table in a restaurant is complex.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: 03 - No social media profiles
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text: There is no social media involvement to promote the business.

rem:section.rem:name: Models of the processes of the current business
Description of the actors of the current business

rem:paragraph.rem:text:
- Owner: Our client, who oversees the general management of the 4 restaurants and decision making of the business. The owner contacts and deals with providers and selects the menu for the restaurants. He delegates his functions to the manager.

- Manager: Skilled person with experience who is in charge of an establishment on behalf of the owner and also watches over a group of workers.

- Waiter: Person in charge of taking commands and bringing dishes to the diner.

- Chef: Person in charge of preparing and cooking food for the diners.

- Diner: Customer who comes to the business to consume the services we offer.

rem:section.rem:name: Description of the processes of the current business

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: [P-01], Booking
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text: To make a booking the client can call the number of the restaurant or fill a form to gather basic information about the booking. Then, a foreman will send an email to the customer to pay the 25% of the price of the selected menu, or 3 euros per diner if there is no selected menu (in this case no tapas will be served, only full sized dishes, unless the only size of the dish is a tapa). This money will be refunded once the diners finish their meal.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: [P-02], Customer enters into a tavern protocol
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text: When a diner enters the tavern, a waiter must ask them if they would like to take a seat, and then ask them what they would like to drink. Then, after the diner or diners have decided what they would like to eat, the waiter will write it down in their working station, and immediately the chefs will start cooking the ordered dishes. Once the food is ready, the chefs will put the dishes in the kitchen window and the waiter will move it to the diners table. When a diner asks for the bill, the waiter will print it with the electronic command and put it in the diners table, wait for them to pay with cash or credit card and say goodbye to them. This process includes [P-04].

rem:name.rem:ref: Customer enters into a tavern protocol

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: [P-03], Waiting list process
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text: When a diner enters the tavern and the capacity of it is full, a waiter will ask them if they want to be in the waiting list. If they do, the waiter will write the name and phone number of the diner in a paper. When a table is free, the waiter must call the diner to let them know that they can come already.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: [P-04], Order
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text: A customer orders food in a tavern and the waiter will write it down in their portable working station. The chef receives the order and cheks if there are all the ingredients necessary, if there aren't they will put on a reminder to call for the provider later at the end of the day, if there are all the ingredients necessary, the chefs will start cooking and when it's done the food will be forwarded to the diner through the waiter.

rem:paragraph.rem:text:
- It is formed by all the working stations that all the four restaurants have, in which the waiters keep track of what the diners order. This hardware uses the software BDP-NET. Working stations can be both portable and static (see figures 8 and 9 below).
There is also wi-fi connection in all of the establishments and two computers in the office, one for the owner and one for the secretary, where they can access the general database.

rem:graphicFile.rem:name: Static working station
Portable working station

rem:paragraph.rem:text:
- The current software environment is composed of a database, a website under the ".es" domain and an application called BDP-Net, which manages the workstations in the restaurants and connects it to the computer in the office (closed software).
Through the website you can ask for a reservation and see the menu online.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-001 Waiter's Rating
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** customer
**I want** to be able to rate the waiters in the restaurant
**So that** other customers can have more opinions.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-005 Rate dishes
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** customer
**I want** to evaluate the different dishes I eat
**So that** I could give my opinion and serve as a reference to other customers

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-015 Dishes ranking
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** customer
**I want to** see a ranking with the best valued or most demanded dishes
**So that** I could choose between a lot of dishes

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-021 Comment the review
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As an** admin
**I want** to be able to leave a comment on a review written by a customer,
**So that** I could interact with customers

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-008 User registration
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** customer
**I want** to be able to register on the website
**So that** I do not have to give my details every time I place an order.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-009 New workers
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As an** admin
**I want** to be able to register new cooks or waiters into the system
**So that** I could give them the necessary permissions to be able to perform their functions.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-018 New dish
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** admin
**I want** to introduce a new dish to the system
**So that** I could expand the menu

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-003 Web Booking
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** client
**I want** to be able to book a table from the website and, optionally, the food I will eat
**So that** I could speed up the process and be waiting less time.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-011 Estimated time
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** client
**I want** to have an estimate of the time I will be able to be attended
**So that** I could be able to choose if I want to wait or not

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-014 Cancel reservation
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** client
**I want to** be able to cancel the reservation I have previously made
**So that** I can be reimbursed on time.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-002 Order history
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** customer
**I want** to be able to see my order history
**So that** I can repeat an order I have already placed.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-006 Digital control
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** cook
**I want** to see the details of the order
**So that** I could attend to them chronologically and guarantee customer satisfaction.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-010 Emergency Orders
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** manager
**I want** to know the estimated time of delivery of the orders
**So that** I could prioritize those that require more speed

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-013 Order status
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** customer
**I want to** be able to see the status of the order and the time remaining for delivery
**So that** I can plan the collection

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-016 Make an order
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** customer
**I want** to place orders, either to be picked up locally or to be sent to the address you specify
**So that** I could choose the best option for me.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-022 Order denied
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** staff member
**I want** to be able to deny a customer an order and specify a reason
**So that** they understand the impossibility of fulfilment

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-004 Promotions
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** customer
**I want** to see the promotions available on the web
**So that** I could access the best offers

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-007 Online menu
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** customer
**I want** to be able to see the menu on the website with photos
**So that** I could have a proper preview of the dishes on offer.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-012 Allergen filtering
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** customer
**I want** to be able to filter the menu according to allergens
**So that** I could avoid food poisoning.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-017 Capacity
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** customer
**I want** to know the current capacity of the establishment
**So that** I can go if it is not full

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-019 Unemployment
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As an** user
**I want** to be able to send my CV
**So that** I could apply for a job

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: US-020 Subscribe to the newsletter
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
**As a** client
**I want** to be able to subscribe to the Tabernas Sevilla newsletter
**So that** I can keep up to date with the latest news.

rem:section.rem:name: Models of the processes of the business to be developed
Description of the actors of the business to be developed

rem:paragraph.rem:text:
The business actors will remain the same as the current ones, with the novelty of User.
- **User**: Customer who has previously registered on the website to order food and/or to make a booking

rem:section.rem:name: Description of the processes of the business to be developed

rem:paragraph.rem:text:
- **Place an order**: after you have registered on the website and logged in, fill in a form with the food you want to order and the time you want to pick it up locally. You can also select the option to have the order delivered to a home address.
- **Book a table**: after you have registered on the website and logged in, you fill in a form specifying which of the four venues you want to book, at what time you want to book a table and, optionally, you can choose what dishes you are going to eat so that when you arrive at the venue, those dishes are already prepared and you don't have to wait too long. You cannot book a table less than one hour in advance
- **Waiting list management**: after you have registered on the website and logged in, you can see the estimated waiting time based on the number of people currently in the venue and the bookings already selected.
- **Rate dishes**: after you have registered on the website, logged in and scanned the invoice for the products consumed, you can rate them. This will form a ranking in which the most ordered dishes and the best rated dishes will participate.

rem:section.rem:name: Description of the subsystems to develop

rem:paragraph.rem:name: Description
rem:paragraph.rem:text:
There will only be a system to develop, that is a website for all to use. This website will use a database to store all the information regarding the users, accounts and the products that are being sold.
The website will be deployed using a tool like Google engine, where you have to pay an amount of money to keep it running, and the database will be stored in the owner's computer, so he can have easy access.

rem:section.rem:name: Catalogue of system requirements to be developed

rem:objective.rem:name: Virtual Booking
rem:objective.rem:description: allow the user to make a booking in a specific time frame

rem:objective.rem:name: Registration
rem:objective.rem:description: allow users to create an account by entering their data, so that they can place orders correctly

rem:objective.rem:name: Online Menu
rem:objective.rem:description: show visitors to the page the letter in digitized format

rem:objective.rem:name: Employees
rem:objective.rem:description: allow the manager to record, modify and delete data on workers in the restaurant

rem:objective.rem:name: Preferences
rem:objective.rem:description: allow users to choose how to pick up the shipment and the establishment they want

rem:objective.rem:name: Cancel Booking
rem:objective.rem:description: allow users to cancel a previously made reservation

rem:graphicFile.rem:name: User case 1
User case 2
User case 3

rem:actor.rem:name: Adminstrator
rem:actor.rem:comments: Pablo Arenas is the only person with this role.

rem:actor.rem:name: Manager
rem:actor.rem:comments: Managers have full access to the page's capabilities.

rem:actor.rem:name: Cook
rem:actor.rem:comments: Cooks have special permissions such as viewing and managing commands.
rem:actor.rem:actorRole: the chefs of the different restaurants

rem:actor.rem:name: Waiter
rem:actor.rem:comments: Waiters have higher permissions than average users, but cannot view commands or modify their data.
rem:actor.rem:actorRole: the waiters of the various restaurants

rem:actor.rem:name: Customer
rem:actor.rem:actorRole: the customers of the different restaurants

rem:useCase.rem:name: Rate service
rem:useCase.rem:triggeringEvent: the customer qualifies the treatment received and his experience as a consumer.
rem:useCase.rem:precondition: The customer must be registered and authenticated to the system
rem:useCase.rem:postcondition: The user has qualified the service and the system has recorded the valuation of the service

rem:useCase.rem:name: View establishment capacity
rem:useCase.rem:triggeringEvent: the capacity of an establishment is requested by the customer
rem:useCase.rem:precondition: The customer must be registered and authenticated to the system
rem:useCase.rem:postcondition: The user has seen the capacity of the establishment

rem:useCase.rem:name: View order history
rem:useCase.rem:triggeringEvent: the order history is requested by the customer.
rem:useCase.rem:precondition: The customer must be registered and authenticated to the system
rem:useCase.rem:postcondition: The user has qualified the service and the system has recorded the valuation of the service

rem:useCase.rem:name: Apply promotions
rem:useCase.rem:triggeringEvent: the customer decides to apply a promotion in force.
rem:useCase.rem:precondition: The customer must be registered and authenticated to the system
rem:useCase.rem:postcondition: The user has applied a promotion and the system has applied the discount to it

rem:useCase.rem:name: Book tables
rem:useCase.rem:triggeringEvent: the customer makes the reservation of a table by determining a time and a place
rem:useCase.rem:precondition: The customer must be registered and authenticated to the system
rem:useCase.rem:postcondition: The user has booked a table and the system has registered that reservation

rem:useCase.rem:name: Cancel order
rem:useCase.rem:triggeringEvent: the customer or processor cancels an order
rem:useCase.rem:precondition: The customer and manager must be registered and authenticated to the system
rem:useCase.rem:postcondition: The user or manager has canceled an order and the system records that cancellation

rem:useCase.rem:name: Place an order
rem:useCase.rem:precondition: The customer must be registered and authenticated to the system
rem:useCase.rem:postcondition: The user has placed an order and the system has posted that order

rem:useCase.rem:name: Rate dish
rem:useCase.rem:precondition: The customer must be registered and authenticated to the system
rem:useCase.rem:postcondition: The user has graded the dish and the system has recorded the valuation of the service

rem:useCase.rem:name: Send CV
rem:useCase.rem:triggeringEvent: the customer submits their CV to offer to work
rem:useCase.rem:precondition: The client does not need to be authenticated to the system
rem:useCase.rem:postcondition: The user has submitted their CV and the system has registered the shipment of the document

rem:useCase.rem:name: View menu
rem:useCase.rem:triggeringEvent: the customer requests to view the menu
rem:useCase.rem:precondition: The customer must be registered and authenticated to the system
rem:useCase.rem:postcondition: The user has qualified the service and the system has recorded the valuation of the service

rem:useCase.rem:name: Modify menu
rem:useCase.rem:triggeringEvent: the admin requests to change the prices or photos of a plate
rem:useCase.rem:precondition: The administrator must be registered and authenticated to the system
rem:useCase.rem:postcondition: The administrator has modified the menu and the system has recorded the change made to the menu

rem:useCase.rem:name: Create promotions
rem:useCase.rem:triggeringEvent: the administrator or manager creates a new promotion
rem:useCase.rem:precondition: The administrator and manager must be authenticated to the system
rem:useCase.rem:postcondition: The administrator and manager have created a promotion and the system has registered the new promotion

rem:useCase.rem:name: Make comments
rem:useCase.rem:triggeringEvent: the administrator comments on a customer review
rem:useCase.rem:precondition: The administrator must be registered and authenticated to the system
rem:useCase.rem:postcondition: The administrator commented and the system posted that comment

rem:useCase.rem:name: View bills
rem:useCase.rem:triggeringEvent: bills are requested by the waiter, cook or manager
rem:useCase.rem:precondition: The waiter, cook and manager must be registered and authenticated to the system
rem:useCase.rem:postcondition: The waiter, the cook or the manager has seen the bills and the system has shown them.

rem:informationRequirement.rem:name: Actor
rem:informationRequirement.rem:relevantConcept: The system must store the information corresponding to the users.

rem:informationRequirement.rem:name: JobApplication
rem:informationRequirement.rem:relevantConcept: The system must store the information corresponding to the CVs.

rem:informationRequirement.rem:name: Booking
rem:informationRequirement.rem:relevantConcept: The system must store the information corresponding to the reservations.

rem:informationRequirement.rem:name: Table
rem:informationRequirement.rem:relevantConcept: The system must store the information corresponding to the tables.

rem:informationRequirement.rem:name: Review
rem:informationRequirement.rem:relevantConcept: The system must store the information corresponding to there views.

rem:informationRequirement.rem:name: Establishment
rem:informationRequirement.rem:relevantConcept: The system must store the information corresponding to the establishments.

rem:informationRequirement.rem:name: Promotion
rem:informationRequirement.rem:relevantConcept: The system must store the information corresponding to the promotions.

rem:informationRequirement.rem:name: Order
rem:informationRequirement.rem:relevantConcept: The system must store the information corresponding to the orders.

rem:informationRequirement.rem:name: Dish
rem:informationRequirement.rem:relevantConcept: The system must store the information corresponding to the dishes.

rem:informationRequirement.rem:name: ReviewComment
rem:informationRequirement.rem:relevantConcept: The system must store the information corresponding to the comments.

rem:informationRequirement.rem:name: OrderCancelation
rem:informationRequirement.rem:relevantConcept: The system must store the information corresponding to the cancellations.

rem:constraintRequirement.rem:name: Limited booking
rem:constraintRequirement.rem:description: The system must comply with the following business rule: The client can't make a reservation in the web-app if the capacity of the establishment is full.

rem:constraintRequirement.rem:name: Maximun duration
rem:constraintRequirement.rem:description: The reservation needs to have an estimated duration of 2 hours in order to make the owner able to accommodate the maximum number of clients possible.full.

rem:constraintRequirement.rem:name: Appointment restricted
rem:constraintRequirement.rem:description: The clients have to be able to make appointments unless it is more than 1 hour in advance in order for the managers to accommodate clients who come without an appointment.

rem:constraintRequirement.rem:name: Waiting list
rem:constraintRequirement.rem:description: The system must respect the following business rule: It is preferable that customers reserve their table before coming whenever possible so that the waiters do not manage a huge waiting list.

rem:constraintRequirement.rem:name: Responsive Web Design
rem:constraintRequirement.rem:description: The system must comply with the following business rule: Customers have to be able to access and view the system on both their smartphone and laptop so as not to limit use to a single device.

rem:constraintRequirement.rem:name: Booking in advance
rem:constraintRequirement.rem:description: The system must comply with the following business rule: Clients must know in advance the time they will be able to sit at a table to make managers or waiters do not have to speed up the process and be able to manage my time.

rem:nonFunctionalRequirement.rem:name: Recovery time
rem:nonFunctionalRequirement.rem:description: take a maximum of 10 minutes to recover from a total crash failure, 95% of the time

rem:nonFunctionalRequirement.rem:name: Clicks
rem:nonFunctionalRequirement.rem:description: allow in 80% of the time that with a maximum of 5 clicks is sufficient to reach the desired information

rem:nonFunctionalRequirement.rem:name: Operating time
rem:nonFunctionalRequirement.rem:description: have a maximum response time of 5 seconds for any query operation

rem:nonFunctionalRequirement.rem:name: CC for JPL
rem:nonFunctionalRequirement.rem:description: have the JAVA code comply with Code Conventions for the Java Programming Language recommendations

rem:nonFunctionalRequirement.rem:name: SQL-92
rem:nonFunctionalRequirement.rem:description: avoid using extensions that are proprietary to the SQL-92 standard in the database management system you use

rem:nonFunctionalRequirement.rem:name: SQL injection
rem:nonFunctionalRequirement.rem:description: be able to prevent systematic SQL injection attacks

rem:constraintRequirement.rem:name: System availability
rem:constraintRequirement.rem:description: The system must be host by Google Engine

rem:constraintRequirement.rem:name: Browsers compatibility
rem:constraintRequirement.rem:comments: Users have to be able to connect on our system with any browser.
rem:constraintRequirement.rem:description: The system has to be available and operational in all the browsers (mozilla firefox, google chrome, internet explorer, safari...)

rem:constraintRequirement.rem:name: H2 Database
rem:constraintRequirement.rem:description: The system must use H2 Database as a database management system for testing

rem:constraintRequirement.rem:name: MySQL
rem:constraintRequirement.rem:description: The system must use MySQL database system

rem:constraintRequirement.rem:name: Spring Boot
rem:constraintRequirement.rem:comments: As a way to have a decent mantainability. The team uses Spring Boot in the professional enviroment.
rem:constraintRequirement.rem:description: The system must use Spring Boot framework

rem:functionalRequirement.rem:name: SSL certificate
rem:functionalRequirement.rem:comments: Adds an 'S' to the end of HTTP
rem:functionalRequirement.rem:description: The system must have a SSL certificate to ensure his security

rem:functionalRequirement.rem:name: Web domain
rem:functionalRequirement.rem:comments: Because the website will be hosted in Spain.
rem:functionalRequirement.rem:description: The system will be hosted under the .es domain

rem:meeting.rem:name: First informal meeting
rem:meeting.rem:results:
The day of the meeting we went to the offices of our client, Pablo Arenas. We met around 5pm and the meeting lasted about an hour and a half. He made it clear to us that his main objective is to sell, every improvement or new functionality that we create does not matter if he cannot sell more than now. First, we listened to our client how his company was working and the computerized system he was using ("BDP" it's the software's name) to better understand his business model and how we could improve it or design new functionalities. He explained in depth how the restaurant business works. He told us that they have 4 establishments in Seville, and each of them has a manager, some waiters and some cooks (the number depends on the location). In these taverns you can find typical spanish tapas, such as croquetas, a variety of meats, san jacobos, cheese, iberic ham... At the end of the day, if some ingredients goes out of stock, the manager of the establishment notifies Pablo Arenas and he proceeds make an order to the providers. We also asked him some questions about the business and the way he manages it, for example: Do you think your business lacks automation?
- "I think we have a pretty computerized business". What are you thinking about to improve your business?
- "Some time ago we thought of a system to manage waitlists, but we gave it up for lack of time to manage it. So I listen to your proposals". How does the booking system works?
- "If you call the telephone number of the tavern or you make a reservation through the web, you have to indicate the number of diners, the time of arival, and you can (optional) specify a menu if you want to have it served quickly when you get here. The cost of reservation is 3 euros per diner, and this ammount will be refunded when you pay before leaving the tavern."
Finally, we chose between the customer and ourselves what we thought was best for his business, we thought four possible solutions: o The "take away" and "delivery" system (to fulfil the main goal: sell more). o Improvement of the restaurant's waitlist management: o Making possible the online booking without going to the restaurant. o Creating a software that manages face-to-face waiting list automatically.

rem:graphicFile.rem:name: Photo of the first meeting

rem:meeting.rem:name: Second meeting
rem:meeting.rem:results:
We had to make this second meeting via Skype due to the ongoing situation caused by the pandemic.
The goal of this meeting was to ask a few doubts we had about the bussiness and to seek approval of our client.
We showed him all of the work we have done so far, what interested him the most was the mockups, and he was very impressed with the result. He liked it overall, but he didn't really understood the purpose of the reviews since it can damage the reputation of the bussiness.
Here are the questions we asked him:
How long can you book in advance? - "You can make a reservation with a maximum of 30 days in advance."
And what are the cancellation policies? - "If you cancell your reservation with a margin of 48 hours or more, you can have your money back, if you cancel it within 48 hours before the reservation we won't make a refund of the money you paid for the booking. We do this to avoid ghost clients."
Can you book outside the tavern or only inside? - "Both, inside and outside."
How do you feel about making promotions like the ones you can find in McDonalds and other fast food chains? - "Well, I haven't seen any bar or restaurant make these kind of offers, but maybe it could work -to have a point system for every time you order something- to keep the clients coming."
After that we talked about the bussiness in these difficult times of the pandemic. Pablo Arenas, our client, told us that during this time they have inmplemented a take-away system (stealing our idea), and they now offer meriendas in their taverns. After all they can handle the situation, if could be worse he told us. He hopes that when all of this is over they can start making the profit they made before the pandemic.

rem:paragraph.rem:text:
Tabernas Sevilla is a well-known chain of restaurants in Seville that has been around since 2001. There are four establishments across the capital, which are usually visited by young adults and families. Its specialty are sevillian tapas and dishes. They also have a very large wine menu

Our system fulfils three fundamental functions for Tabernas Sevilla's business model. It is based on a web page that allows the ordering of commands on-line. Using a computerized web menu, users can select which dishes from Tabernas Sevilla's extensive menu they wish to order and which of the 4 restaurants available throughout Seville to collect them from, giving them an estimated time to collect the order on site or selecting delivery to the previously specified address.

In addition, it has the functionality implemented to manage the capacity of the bar's customers, being able to make table reservations in advance by agreeing on a time, and if desired, also agreeing on the dishes to be consumed. In this way, the client does not have to wait for his dishes when he arrives at the bar but can enjoy them in the best possible way. This helps to solve one of the basic problems of the business, the management of the waiting list, which is currently done by hand by the waiters.

rem:graphicFile.rem:name: Detailed view of layers, services and architecture

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: The MVC pattern in Spring
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
The Spring Web MVC framework provides Model-View-Controller (MVC) architecture and ready components that can be used to develop flexible and loosely coupled web applications. The MVC pattern results in separating the different aspects of the application (input logic, business logic, and UI logic), while providing a loose coupling between these elements.
The Model encapsulates the application data and in general they will consist of POJO.
The View is responsible for rendering the model data and in general it generates HTML output that the client's browser can interpret.
The Controller is responsible for processing user requests and building an appropriate model and passes it to the view for rendering.

rem:glossaryItem.rem:name: Detailed view of layers, services and architecture
rem:glossaryItem.rem:text:
1. Request
The first step in the MVC flow is when a request is received by the Dispatcher Servlet.
2. Dispatcher Servlet
Now, the Dispatcher Servlet will with the help of Handler Mapping understand the Controller class name associated with the received request. Once the Dispatcher Servlet knows which Controller will be able to handle the request, it will transfer the request to it.
3. Controller
The Controller will process the request based on appropriate methods and will return it to Model Data and View Name.
4. Model and View
It will return the processed data to the Dispatcher Servlet.
5. View Resolver
Once Model and View receive the data, Dispatcher Servlet will transfer it to the View Resolver to get the actual view page.
6. View
Finally, the Dispatcher Servlet will pass the Model object (results) to the view page. This is the final step of the flow where the results will be displayed.

rem:section.rem:name: Model of classes of the system

rem:graphicFile.rem:name: Data model

rem:paragraph.rem:name: Description of the data model
rem:paragraph.rem:text:
There are 5 actors in the system: admin, customer, waiter, manager and cool. The website will have 3 different account privileges, customer, cook and admin.
There is a message system between the actors of the system, to send information about orders inside a tavern or from delivieries.
Each time an order is made through the website, the system will allow the user to wirte a review about the dish. Also, the take away system will send the user an email every time the state of the delivery changes (as seen in the user interface prototype).
Promotions and JobApplication are both connected to an estabilshment because they both depend on the tavern.
Bookings are always associated to an establishment, and it can be made as long as there is free space inside or outside a tavern. A booking or reservation can introduce an order, so that when you arrive to the establishment, you have your food ready to eat without having to order and wait.
All dishes have a list of allergens associated, and depending on whether or not that specific allergen can be found in the dish, the value "isPresent" will be true or false. So a dish might have 3 allergens listed but if they all have "isPresent" false, that dish does not contain any allergen.

rem:graphicFile.rem:name: General view of the website, where we can see how to access most of the functionalities of the web app.
Registration view
Online menu. Unregistered user view. You can select whether if you like to view food or drinks. There is also a filter to see which ones do not have specific allergens.
Promotions view. Unregistered user view. Where anyone can see the promotions available.
User profile view. Registered user view. Where you can change your credentials and personal data, add an address for your deliveries, and access other functionalities of the web-app.
History view. Registered user view. Where you can view past orders easily in case you want to repeat something.
Privacy settings view. Registered user view. Where you can subscribe to the Newsletter or delete your account.
User reviews view. Registered user view. Here you can see the reviews the registered user has written.

Booking/reservation view. Unregistered user view. Where you can make a reservation in any of the establishments, inside or outside. You can also select if you are lactose intolerant or celiac to take it into account.
Chef data view. Registered chef view. Where the user-type-chef can see and change their personal data. This chef is registered by the administrator (seen later).

Electronic command view. Registered chef view. Where a chef can see the orders associated with their establishment. The orders are shown depending on the emergency, and they can be cancelled by the chef.
Manage chefs' view. Admin view. The admin is the only type of user who can add chefs to a given establishment (or to delete them).
Register chef view. Admin view. Form to register a new chef.

Checkout view. Unregistered user view. When you finish selecting what you want to eat, you must confirm the order. You can choose to have it delivered to you address or to pick it up in a tavern. You must be logged in before ordering food.
Confirmation of order view. Registered user view. When you confirm an order, you can see the state of it, its details, and the estimated delivery time.

Establishment view. Unregistered user view. When selecting a tavern, you can see a ranking of the waiters whom you can rate and write reviews about when you log in. This view also indicated the current capacity and the estimated time of availability.
Manage products view. Admin view. Where the admin can view and add all the dishes and wines/drinks available in all taverns.
Add product view. Admin view. Where the admin adds a new item, dish or drink.
Employment view. Registered user view (can be accessed without registration). Where you can send your CV to the business.

rem:paragraph.rem:text: The rest of the user interface is discarded work, since out client has changed his mind on these functionalities.

rem:graphicFile.rem:name: Product review view. Where a registered who had previously ordered the item can write or just rate a product with up to 5 stars. The admin can interact with the customers by replying to the comment.

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: No rastreabilidad
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos no están trazados hacia sus orígenes, bien requisitos de nivel superior (objetivos), bien clientes y usuarios

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: Estabilidad no establecida
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos no tienen estimada su estabilidad

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: Ambigüedad
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos, aunque comprensibles, tienen más de una interpretación posible

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: Redundancia
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos son redundantes o contienen elementos redundantes

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: Nivel incorrecto de detalle
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos no están expresados con el nivel adecuado de detalle, es decir, son demasiado abstractos o demasiado detallados

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: Otro
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos presentan otro tipo de defecto

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: No implementabilidad
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos no pueden ser implementados con la tecnología actual o dentro de un coste razonable

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: No necesidad
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos no son necesarios porque no contribuyen a satisfacer ninguna necesidad de clientes o usuarios

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: Verbosidad excesiva
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos pueden expresarse de forma más concisa sin alterar su significado

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: Inconsistencia
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos no son consistentes, es decir, presentan contradicciones internas o entre varios

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: No verificabilidad
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: No se puede comprobar que el sistema satisface el requisito o requisitos

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: Dependiente del diseño
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos incluyen elementos dependientes del diseño del sistema

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: Incompleción
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos no describen todo lo que el sistema se supone que deberá hacer, no describen las respuestas del sistema a todas las posibles situaciones o incluyen elementos por determinar (PD)

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: Organización incorrecta
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos no están organizados correctamente según la normativa aplicada o el documento no contiene las secciones obligatorias

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: Imprecisión
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos no se expresan de forma precisa, es decir, usando cantidades numéricas siempre que sea posible con el nivel adecuado de precisión

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: Prioridad no establecida
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos no tienen establecida su prioridad, es decir, su importancia y su urgencia

rem:defectTypeValue.rem:name: Incomprensibilidad
rem:defectTypeValue.rem:description: El requisito o requisitos no pueden ser entendidos por algún lector
